page.title: 18A VISIT TO I.B.M.
page.content:
When we got to I.B.M. we asked for Mr. Canning.We signed the visitors book and put on name badges.Mr.Canning took us to the fourth floor.
We sat in some really nice seats and Jacqueline told him why we had come.We asked some questions,about ten each,there were four of us.Then we were shown around. Our teacher took some{photographs}of{Northolt}and{ {Greenford}from the top of the building.We saw a computer worth Â£2.25 million.We saw a computerised supermarket checkout and several autobanks.
I.B.M.(International Business Machines) make {computers,typewriters} and other office equipment. About 300 people work at I.B.M. It is a training school for engineers.
